News quiz: Test your knowledge of this week in Berkeley news

Did you follow the news in Berkeley this week, Feb. 11-16? To take our quiz, choose an answer, and the correct response will appear after you click.

By Ian MacGregor and Alexandra Yoon-Hendricks
FEB. 16, 2018

Since Feb. 5, the only immigration attorney for UC Berkeley’s Undocumented Student Program, or USP, has been on paid administrative leave. Why was Prerna Lal placed on leave?

Misconduct allegations Dispute with managers Lawsuit filed Still unknown

Correct!

Not quite!

According to Lal, their boss said USP requested that Lal be placed on administrative leave at the East Bay Community Law Center — which the campus contracts for immigration legal services — because some students allegedly complained about Lal.

But campus spokesperson Janet Gilmore said that it is “absolutely untrue” that USP requested that Lal be placed on administrative leave.

Read more: The jury’s out on why Undocumented Student Program’s only lawyer is still on paid administrative leave

Berkeley City Council recently lowered the city’s recreational marijuana tax. What percentage did it drop to?

15 percent 10 percent 5 percent 2.5 percent

Correct!

Not quite!

City officials lowered the city’s recreational tax amid criticism from business owners and stakeholders that customers were experiencing “sticker shock.”

Read more: Berkeley lowers recreational cannabis tax from 10 to 5 percent

This week, the Berkeley Forum hosted an speaker event on the subject of fear and religion. Who was their speaker?

Robert Baer, a former CIA agent Vinton Cerf, chief internet evangelist at Google Rachel Vogelstein, director at the Council on Foreign Relations Peter Goettler, president and CEO of the Cato Institute

Correct!

Not quite!

Author and former CIA agent Robert Baer discussed the politics of faith and fear, talking about how societies such as Lebanon and Iraq have transitioned from secularism to religious fanaticism.

Read more: Former CIA agent discusses fear and religion at Berkeley Forum event

Berkeley high schoolers recently launched a GoFundMe campaign to provide care packages to whom?

Shelter animals Wildfire victims Homeless residents Children in hospitals

Correct!

Not quite!

A Berkeley High School club launched the campaign in January to raise $1,000 for “B.I.O.N.I.C Boxes” (which stands for Believe It Or Not I Care). The boxes will include water, snacks for the day and hygiene products such as sanitary wipes and tampons.

Read more: Berkeley high schoolers fundraising to give care packages to homeless

A UC Berkeley alumnus is suing an airline company for racial discrimination after he was removed from a flight in 2016 after speaking Arabic before takeoff. Which airline is he suing?

Alaska Airlines United Airlines JetBlue Southwest Airlines

Correct!

Not quite!

Khairuldeen Makhzoomi is seeking compensatory and punitive damages against Southwest Airlines for the alleged violation of his civil rights and for the emotional distress caused during the April 2016 incident.

Read more: UC Berkeley alumnus removed from Southwest flight after speaking Arabic files suit
